Edward P. Opperman is an American private investigator, digital forensics expert, and media personality. He is best known as the host of The Opperman Report, a weekly investigative talk show that airs on radio stations and podcast platforms across the United States.
Early life and education
Details about Opperman's early life and education are not widely documented. He began working in counter-electronic surveillance in the early 1980s and later transitioned into digital forensics.
Career
Private investigation and digital forensics
Opperman is the president of Opperman Investigations Inc. and the founder of Accurate Information Recovery, a company specializing in digital forensics, including email tracing and cellphone data recovery. His work gained prominence in the early 2000s, particularly in collaboration with pioneers in the field of cellphone data recovery.
The Opperman Report
Since the 2010s, Opperman has hosted The Opperman Report, a radio show and podcast focused on crime, conspiracy, and legal ethics. The show is syndicated on AM/FM radio and reaches over 150 U.S. cities.
Notable work
Opperman has investigated numerous high-profile cases, including early inquiries into the Jeffrey Epstein network beginning in 2013. He is a regular guest on investigative podcasts and often comments on legal and forensic developments.
